greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n is odd then a(n) = n, else a(n) = n*(n+2).
comment: Order of Fibonacci group F(n+1,2) (0 means group is infinite). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 30 2011
reference: D. L. Johnson, Presentation of Groups, Cambridge, 1976, p. 182.
Thomas, Richard M., The Fibonacci groups revisited, in Groups - St. Andrews 1989, Vol. 2, 445-454, London Math. Soc. Lecture Note Ser., 160, Cambridge Univ. Press, Cambridge, 1991.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=0,...,1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,3,0,-3,0,1).
program: (PARI) { for (n=0, 1000, if (n%2, a=n, a=n*(n + 2)); write("b065530.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Oct 20 2009
results.author: _George E. Antoniou_, Dec 02 2001
